recipe_name: Parma ham and spinach salad with croûtons and balsamic dressing
author: Nick Nairn
method: For the salad, heat one tablespoon of the oil in a large non-stick frying pan and fry the parma ham for one minute on each side, or until golden-brown. Remove from the pan and drain on kitchen paper. In the same pan, heat the remaining oil, place the ciabatta slices into the pan and cook until golden-brown. Place the spinach and tomato into a large bowl. Place the dressing ingredients into a small bowl, mix together well and pour over the salad. Mix well to combine. Transfer the salad to a large plate and top with the croutons and parma ham.
ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil,  3 slices parma ham,  4 thin slices ciabatta,  200g/7oz baby spinach, washed,  ½ beef tomato, seeds removed, chopped,  1 tbsp chopped fresh chives,  1 tbsp balsamic vinegar,  1 tbsp olive oil,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
